results.title: She's a railroader
results.creator_credit: Barbara Tranter, John Taylor, Shelah Reljic and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Karen Zaitchik jumps on and off moving boxcars, throws switches, pulls brakes and uncouples freights with ease and confidence. She’s a railroader for CN and that’s what this 21-year-old highly individualistic woman wants out of life for the moment. This colorful short film shows how Karen manages in the traditionally male world of the railroad.

results.title: Shaping things: a choreographic journal
results.brief_description: Frances Alenikoff is seen working with her Frances Alenikoff Dance Theater Company. Her choreography is based on improvisation coupled with structured shape to achieve modern dance movements. She is seen discussing her ideas about dance choreography and what she hopes to achieve through her work.

results.title: Shattered dreams
results.creator_credit: Wendy Hill-Tout, Dale Phillips and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Schizophrenia is a disease shrouded in ignorance and myth. This confronting and emotional film details the story of the Martini family who had two sons diagnosed with the disease. Clem Martini, a third brother, narrates the film and through his words we come to understand the grief and pain experienced by the schizophrenics and their families and friends. Passionate and illuminating, “Shattered Dreams” argues for an increased public knowledge of schizophrenia and mental illness.

results.title: Shark shocker; Turning turtle
results.brief_description: Two episodes of the “Blue Wilderness” series in which Ron and Valerie Taylor investigate conservation methods for sea creatures. In “Shark shocker” they go to South Africa to see an electronic shark barrier, which may deter sharks from swimming near beaches, as an alternative to nets which trap other sea creatures. In “Turning turtle” the Taylor’s show the need for rescue work with sea turtles on Raine Island off the Queensland coast.

results.title: Shantiniketan: Abode of Peace
results.creator_credit: K Samarth, A P Sinha, M. Bhavnani and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: In 1901, there was established at Shantiniketan an institution for boys and girls, where education was in close communion with nature. Twenty years later, the institution had grown to such proportions that it came to be recognised as an international university, the Visva-Bharati. This film gives an interesting glimpse of Shantiniketan the “Abode of peace”, the school of international culture, established by the Poet Rabindranath Tagore at Bolpur, not far from Calcutta. Languages, sculpture, painting, embroidery, music, dancing and other fine arts are an integral part of training.

results.title: Shane Warne
results.creator_credit: Stephen Phillips and Australian Cricket Video
results.brief_description: This is the story of Shane Warne’s mercurial career in his own words. Named one of the five greatest cricketers of the 20th century and Australia’s greatest wicket taker in Test cricket, he commentates on footage of most of the highlights of his career so far, including his Test debut against India in 1991/92, the Test match hat-trick, and the 1999 World Cup victory. He also discusses many amusing behind the scenes tales as well as some of his greatest rivals.

results.title: Shakespeare's theatre: The Globe Playhouse
results.creator_credit: Mildred Jordon, William Jordan and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Shows a model reconstruction of the Globe Playhouse, illustrating the separate stages, machinery, fixed scenery and acting conventions in brief extracts from Shakespeare’s plays as they were probably first performed. Incldues excerpts from Julius Caesar, Hamlet, Macbeth, Twelfth Night and Romeo and Juliet.
